name: SpaceExerciseModalityCS
title: Space Exercise Modality Code System
description: Spaceflight-specific exercise modalities used in microgravity and partial gravity environments (e.g., ISS treadmill, ARED resistive training, artificial gravity).

concept.definition: Running or walking on a vibration-isolated treadmill with harness-based body-weight simulation.
Seated or supine cycling on a vibration-isolated ergometer with adjustable resistance.
Heavy-load resistive exercise using a flywheel or vacuum-based Advanced Resistive Exercise Device.
Squat movements using ARED or equivalent resistive hardware.
Deadlift movements using ARED or equivalent resistive hardware.
Calf-raise movements using ARED or equivalent resistive hardware.
Exercise performed in a short-radius or long-radius centrifuge providing partial or full gravity.
Portable elastic-band or bungee-based resistive training.
Exercise performed with harness-based body-weight simulation, typically on a treadmill.

name: SpacePerformanceMetricCS
title: Space Exercise Performance Metric Code System
description: Key performance metrics for space-based exercise sessions (e.g., power output, VO2 surrogate, effective ground reaction force).

concept.definition: Average mechanical power output over the activity interval.
Maximum mechanical power achieved during the activity.
Effective body-weight load, typically as a fraction of 1-g weight, during harness or artificial gravity exercise.
Total work performed across the activity interval.
Computed surrogate for oxygen uptake based on HR, power, and subject parameters.
Heart rate recorded one minute after cessation of exercise.
Intensity expressed as % of heart rate reserve.
Effective ground reaction force during treadmill exercise with harness loading.
Resistance setting on exercise equipment.
Steps per minute (treadmill) or revolutions per minute (cycle ergometer).

name: AerospaceBehavioralStateCS
title: Aerospace Behavioral State Code System
description: Codes describing behavioral and psychological state parameters in aerospace missions.

concept.definition: Numeric or ordinal scoring of current mood (e.g., -3 to +3).
Numeric or ordinal scoring of current anxiety state.
Behavioral metric representing irritability and frustration.
Estimated probability or degree of interpersonal conflict risk.
Perceived ability to cope with mission demands and stressors.
Integrated measure of stress load over a defined mission interval.
Degree of perceived social support and connectedness with crew and ground.
Subjective or composite index of sleep quality.
Readiness for complex decision-making and EVA or critical operations.

name: BehavioralBiomarkerCS
title: Behavioral Biomarker Code System
description: Codes for physiologic and digital biomarkers related to behavioral health and stress.

concept.definition: Cortisol concentration used as a stress biomarker.
Root-mean-square or similar measure of HRV in milliseconds.
Total nightly sleep duration in hours.
Percentage of time in bed spent asleep.
Number of awakenings during sleep period.
Derived metric from speech prosody indicating stress level.
Gross motor activity level from accelerometry.
Reaction time in milliseconds from vigilance or cognitive tests.

name: IsolationSyndromeFactorCS
title: Isolation Syndrome Factor Code System
description: Factors contributing to isolation, confinement, and psychosocial risk in aerospace missions.

concept.definition: Small volume, limited privacy, constrained movement.
Limited visual, auditory, and olfactory variety.
Crew tension, conflict, or poor communication.
Unclear or conflicting roles and responsibilities.
Misalignment of sleep-wake cycle with operational schedule.
Long delays to ground communication reducing perceived support.
Recent anomalies or near-miss events increasing stress load.
Unequal distribution of work or perceived unfairness.

name: PsychologicalCountermeasureCS
title: Psychological Countermeasure Code System
description: Codes for psychological countermeasure interventions in aerospace missions.

concept.definition: Formal CBT or counseling session (in-person or telemedicine).
Non-directive supportive conversation with behavioral health personnel.
Physical exercise targeting stress reduction or mood improvement.
Timed bright light exposure to stabilize circadian rhythms.
Structured mindfulness or meditation session.
Guided crew-level debrief to process events and conflict.
Behavioral intervention to improve sleep habits.
Medication used to reduce acute anxiety.
Medication used to promote sleep.
Immersive virtual environment for relaxation or mood support.

name: NeutralBuoyancyTrainingCS
title: Neutral Buoyancy Training Code System
description: Specialized codes for neutral buoyancy training activities and assessments

concept.definition: Extravehicular activity simulation in neutral buoyancy pool
Training for handling tools and equipment in weightless environment
Training for emergency escape procedures from spacecraft
Multi-astronaut coordination and communication training
Introduction and practice with space equipment
Training for assembly of space habitats and structures
Training for geological and biological sample collection
Training for spacecraft and equipment maintenance
Time required to complete assigned tasks
Assessment of movement and navigation efficiency
Quality of underwater communication systems
Response time to emergency scenarios
Skill in manipulating tools and equipment
Ability to maintain orientation in 3D environment
Performance under stress and unexpected conditions
NASA's Neutral Buoyancy Laboratory facility
Commercial neutral buoyancy training facility
Training conducted in natural water environments
Underwater habitat for extended training missions

name: DivingMedicineCS
title: Diving Medicine Code System
description: Medical codes specific to diving medicine and hyperbaric treatments

concept.definition: Comprehensive medical examination for diving fitness
Medical clearance for hyperbaric exposures
Assessment of physical fitness for diving operations
Medical evaluation following diving incident
Annual medical recertification for diving
Complete diving profile including depth and time data
Deepest point reached during dive
Time spent at maximum depth
Rate of ascent from depth
Time spent at surface between dives
Time required for decompression stops
Composition of breathing gas used
Temperature of water during dive
Visual range underwater
Water current strength and direction
Calculated nitrogen saturation in tissues
Required decompression stops
Maximum time at depth without required stops
Dive with residual nitrogen from previous dive
Pressure equivalent at sea level
US Navy Treatment Table 5 for mild DCS
US Navy Treatment Table 6 for serious DCS
US Navy Treatment Table 6A with extensions
US Navy Treatment Table 4 for arterial gas embolism
Hyperbaric oxygen for wound healing
Hyperbaric oxygen for CO poisoning
Two-diver safety protocol
Diving with surface-supplied breathing gas
Procedures for emergency surface ascent
Search and rescue procedures for missing diver
Response to life support equipment failure

name: DecompressionProtocolCS
title: Decompression Protocols and Procedures
description: Standardized decompression protocols and safety procedures

concept.definition: Bühlmann decompression algorithm
RGBM decompression algorithm
VPM decompression algorithm
US Navy decompression tables
NOAA decompression tables
PADI recreational decompression tables
Standard 3-minute safety stop at 15 feet
Extended 5-minute safety stop
Deep safety stop at half maximum depth
Required decompression stop
Emergency decompression procedure
Standard controlled ascent procedure
Rapid emergency ascent procedure
Ascent with assistance from dive partner
Controlled emergency swimming ascent
Emergency ascent using buoyancy control
Switching to nitrox decompression gas
Switching to pure oxygen for decompression
Switching between trimix breathing gases
Air break during oxygen decompression
Decompression procedures for altitude diving
Cold water decompression considerations
Decompression in overhead environments
Multiple dive decompression planning

name: UnderwaterCommunicationCS
title: Underwater Communication Systems
description: Communication systems and protocols for underwater training operations

concept.definition: Physical cable-based communication system
Wireless underwater communication system
Communication with surface support team
Communication between divers underwater
Communication through full face diving mask
Bone conduction underwater communication
Air-powered communication system
Standardized underwater hand signal protocol
Emergency communication procedures
Signal to immediately terminate dive operation
Signal requesting help from dive partner
Signal to ascend to surface without delay
General problem indication signal
All clear/everything normal signal
System communication verification
Quality of communication signal
Secondary communication system
Loss of communication capability
Testing effective communication range

name: RegulatoryComplianceCS
title: Diving and Space Medicine Regulatory Compliance
description: Regulatory standards and compliance codes for diving and space medicine

concept.definition: NOAA Diving Manual standards compliance
NOAA diving medical standards
NOAA diver training standards
NOAA diving equipment standards
OSHA 29 CFR 1910 Subpart T compliance
OSHA diving medical requirements
OSHA diving safety standards
American Academy of Underwater Sciences standards
AAUS diver training certification
AAUS medical fitness requirements
NASA Neutral Buoyancy Laboratory operating procedures
NASA diving safety standards
NASA astronaut medical standards
NASA astronaut training protocols
ISO 24801 diving services standards
European diving services standards
Canadian Standards Association diving
Professional commercial diving certification
Scientific diving certification
Public safety diving certification
Diving instructor certification

name: SpaceRadiationTypeCS
title: Space Radiation Type Code System
description: Types of radiation encountered in space environments

name: AerospaceCodeSystemEnhanced
title: Enhanced Aerospace Medicine Code System
description: Comprehensive code system for aerospace medicine concepts including all referenced codes

title: Space Nutrition Product Types
description: Types of nutritional products used in space missions

title: Hydration Product Types
description: Types of hydration products used in space
